law.text: It is declared to be in the interest of the public welfare that Kentucky farmers who are producers of grain which may be fermented to produce ethanol to be mixed with gasoline to make the fuel known as gasohol shall be permitted and encouraged to act jointly and in cooperation with all producers, handlers, dealers, and processors of grain in promoting and stimulating, by research, market development, and education, the increased production, use and sale, domestic and foreign, of grain for the aforementioned purpose of gasohol production.
law.history: Created 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 210, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1980.
